body_html:
@sguada
I have tried slim.get_or_create_global_step(). Still the same problem, the global_step/sec just becomes 0 and training freezes just after session created. Since the global_step is created just at the beginning of the graph, it is probably not because different global_step is created
body_text:
@sguada

body:
@sguada 
I have tried slim.get_or_create_global_step(). Still the same problem, the **global_step/sec** just becomes 0 and training freezes just after session created. Since the global_step is created just at the beginning of the graph, it is probably not because different global_step is created
